predictions.text: ICE Brent crude oil front-month futures will settle at or above $92.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via ICE Futures Europe official settlement for the front-month Brent contract (e.g., BRN). Any official settlement price ≥ $92.00 on or before 2025-10-31 (UTC) satisfies.
monitoring_signals: Red Sea/Suez and Strait of Hormuz shipping risks
predictions.rationale: Iran snapback sanctions raise Middle East risk premium into Q4 amid tight non-OPEC supply and seasonal demand.

predictions.text: EUR/USD will trade at or below 1.0400 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Per Yahoo Finance (ticker EURUSD=X), any daily intraday low ≤ 1.0400 between publication and 2025-11-30 (UTC) qualifies.
monitoring_signals: U.S.–euro area 2-year yield and swap differentials
European growth PMIs and energy prices
predictions.rationale: Higher-for-longer U.S. yields and lingering risk premia support the dollar while euro area growth underperforms.

predictions.text: U.S. nonfarm payrolls (change, seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will be between 120,000 and 220,000 in the BLS Employment Situation on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS Employment Situation news release: headline change in total nonfarm payroll employment (seasonally adjusted). Range inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Initial and continuing jobless claims (4-week average)
predictions.rationale: Hiring cools but remains positive amid softer goods demand and still-tight labor markets.

predictions.text: U.S. Retail Sales 'control group' (advance) month-over-month for September 2025 will print between -0.2% and +0.4% in the Census release on 2025-10-16.
predictions.verification_criteria: U.S. Census Advance Monthly Retail and Food Services: control group defined as sales excluding motor vehicles & parts, gasoline, building materials, and food services; verify the MoM percent change; range inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Back-to-school promo intensity and retailer commentary
Gasoline prices and CPI goods inflation
predictions.rationale: Promotions and soft goods demand are partly offset by wealth effects; nominal growth remains modest.

predictions.text: University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment (final) for October 2025 will print between 65.0 and 74.0 in the release due 2025-10-25.
predictions.verification_criteria: University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers—final headline index value for October 2025; range inclusive.
predictions.rationale: Sentiment steadies as equities stay firm, but high rates and price levels cap gains.

predictions.text: U.S. 2-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS2) will close at or above 4.90% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED series DGS2 daily close; any observation ≥ 4.90% through 2025-11-30 (UTC) qualifies.
monitoring_signals: Treasury issuance/bill supply and term premium estimates
predictions.rationale: Sticky services inflation and policy uncertainty keep front-end yields elevated at times.

predictions.text: From 2025-09-26 close to 2025-10-31 close, the Russell 2000 Index (^RUT) will underperform the S&P 500 Index (^GSPC) by at least 3.0 percentage points based on percentage change in adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Yahoo Finance adjusted close prices. Compute percent change for ^RUT and ^GSPC between 2025-09-26 and 2025-10-31 closes. Outcome satisfied if (^RUT %chg) − (^GSPC %chg) ≤ -3.0 percentage points.
monitoring_signals: 2Y and 10Y Treasury yields and credit spreads
Small-cap earnings revisions and margin guidance
Market breadth and risk appetite indicators
predictions.rationale: Small caps are more rate-sensitive and exposed to margin pressures from tariffs and financing costs.

predictions.text: U.S. core CPI (all items less food and energy, year-over-year) for September 2025 will be between 3.1% and 3.3% in the BLS release on 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS CPI press release: 12-month percent change for 'All items less food and energy'. Range inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Shelter inflation (rent/OER) and new lease indicators
predictions.rationale: Core disinflation progresses gradually, restrained by sticky services categories.

predictions.text: EIA-reported 4-week average U.S. crude oil exports will reach at or above 4.50 million barrels per day in at least one Weekly Petroleum Status Report published by 2025-11-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report: check the 4-week moving average for U.S. Exports of Crude Oil; any report with value ≥ 4.50 mb/d through 2025-11-15 qualifies.
predictions.rationale: Sanctions-driven rerouting and wider Brent–WTI spreads support higher U.S. crude export flows.

predictions.text: NYMEX Henry Hub natural gas front-month futures will settle at or above $3.75 per MMBtu on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: CME/NYMEX official settlement for the prompt-month NG contract (ticker NG). Any settlement ≥ $3.75/MMBtu through 2025-11-30 (UTC) satisfies.
monitoring_signals: LNG feedgas flows and export capacity
Power sector gas burns and coal-to-gas switching
predictions.rationale: Shoulder season fades; early winter risk plus strong power demand can lift prompt gas prices.

predictions.text: Euro area HCOB Flash Composite PMI for October 2025 will print at or below 50.2 in the release due 2025-10-24.
predictions.verification_criteria: S&P Global/HCOB euro area flash PMI news release; verify the headline composite PMI value for October 2025. Outcome satisfied if value ≤ 50.2.
monitoring_signals: Euro area new orders and export orders subindices
Credit standards (ECB BLS) and energy costs
Survey price pressures vs demand indicators
predictions.rationale: Manufacturing softness and cautious services keep composite near stagnation.
